page.title: 20WILDLIFE ON THE DOWNS
page.content:
We saw lots of minibeasts on our walk.There were ants on the ground and a worm in the mud. Somebody turned over a big stone. Underneath we found lots of woodlice, an earwig and centipede.In the long grass there were ladybirds and a grass-hopper. We saw a slug and lots of banded snails in the nettles. James saw a black beetle and a cabbage white butterfly. Two girls saw a spider in a web. A woodlouse has fourteen legs. A centipede has lots of legs and a spider has eight legs. Snails and slugs move on a muscular foot. All the rest are insects which have six legs.
Birds. On our walk we saw these birds- starlings, crows, swallows, doves, woodpigeons a blackbird and sparrows.
